Empty Product
In a monoid, the empty product is defined as the unit element, i.e., $\prod_{i=1}^{0} a_{i} := e$, where $e$ is the unit element.
Dedekind Domain

A Dedekind domain is an integral domain in which the theorem on unique prime factorization holds for ideals. It is a nonzero ring without nontrivial zero divisors, and Dedekind's theorem on unique prime factorization for ideals is applicable.
Integral Domain
A commutative ring R is called an integral domain if it is nonzero and does not admit nontrivial zero divisors.
Finitely Generated Ideal
An ideal $\mathfrak{a}$ in a ring $R$ is finitely generated if it admits a finite system of generators.
Ring Endomorphism
An endomorphism of a ring $R$ is a homomorphism $\varphi: R \longrightarrow R$.
Localization of a Ring

Given a ring $R$ and a multiplicative system $S \subset R$, the localization $S^{-1}R$ (or $R_S$) is the ring of fractions $ rac{a}{s}$ where $a \in R$ and $s \in S$, under an equivalence relation defined by $ rac{a}{s} =  rac{a'}{s'}$ if there exists some $s'' \in S$ such that $as's'' = a'ss''$.
Galois Group of a Polynomial Splitting Fields
The Galois group of a polynomial equation is the group of automorphisms of the splitting field of the polynomial that fix the base field. These automorphisms permute the roots of the polynomial.
Algebraic Field Extension
The extension field $L$ is called algebraic over $K$ if every element $\alpha \in L$ is algebraic over $K$.
Algebraic Closure of Finite Field

An algebraic closure $\\[\overline{\mathbb{F}}_p\]$ of a finite field $\\[\mathbb{F}_p\]$ is a field that contains $\\[\mathbb{F}_p\]$ and all its algebraic extensions. It is used to view the fields $\\[\mathbb{F}_{p^n}\]$ as subfields.
Stabilizer
Let $G \times X \longrightarrow X$ be an action of a group $G$ on a set $X$. The stabilizer or isotropy subgroup of a point $x \in X$ is defined as $G_{x}:=\{g \in G ; g x=x\}$.
Symmetric Group
The symmetric group, denoted as $\mathfrak{S}_{n}$, is the group of all bijective self-maps of the set $\{1, \ldots, n\}$.
Map/Function
A map is a relationship between two sets that associates every element in one set(domain) to exactly one element in another set (codomain).
Definition_Association_Analysis

Implied_Association_Relationships.Explanation: A Dedekind domain is defined as an integral domain with additional properties. Therefore, the concept of an integral domain must be defined to understand what a Dedekind domain is.
A finitely generated ideal is defined within the context of a ring. Therefore, the concept of a ring must be defined to understand what a finitely generated ideal is.

The localization of a ring is defined in terms of a ring and a multiplicative system within that ring. Therefore, the concept of a ring must be defined to understand what the localization of a ring is.

The Galois group of a polynomial splitting field is defined in terms of automorphisms of the splitting field. Therefore, the concept of an automorphism (which is a specific type of map/function) must be defined to understand what the Galois group is.

An algebraic field extension is defined in terms of fields and algebraic elements over those fields. Therefore, the concept of a field must be defined to understand what an algebraic field extension is.
An algebraic closure of a finite field is defined in terms of the field and its algebraic extensions. Therefore, the concept of a field must be defined to understand what an algebraic closure is.
The stabilizer is defined in terms of a group action on a set. Therefore, the concept of a group must be defined to understand what a stabilizer is.
The symmetric group is defined as the group of all bijective self-maps of a set. Therefore, the concept of a map/function must be defined to understand what the symmetric group is.
